alert.note: Alert for Benton; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 5:19AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Benton, southwestern Washington, southeastern Delaware, Adair and southeastern Cherokee Counties through 600 AM CDT... At 519 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 5 miles west of Cherokee Landing State Park, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Tahlequah... Siloam Springs... Stilwell... Gentry... Lincoln... Decatur... Westville... West Siloam Springs... Watts... Adair State Park... Christie... Cincinnati... Maryetta... Cookson... Cherokee Landing State Park... Baron... Eldon... Proctor... Ballard... Wedington... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until noon CDT for northwestern Arkansas...and northeastern Oklahoma. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for northeastern and east central Oklahoma.
